analytic.title: A Syriac Orthodox List of Diyāqūs (Servants of the Church) from the Late Ottoman Period

biblStruct.note: This article examines a unique list of servants of the church from the late Ottoman Empire, preserved In a Garshuni manuscript at the Church of the Forty Martyrs' Library in Mardin, Turkey. The document offers rare insights into the Syriac Orthodox community's church activities, social issues, and post-World War I life. Through this list, one can learn about the demographics and geography of Syriac communities in southeastern Turkey, discover lesser-known villages and churches, and better understand the religious, cultural, and sociaI dynamics of Syrlac Orthodox church.
